variant.question: Skill based behaviour is based on practice and prior learning, to become part of the "muscle memory", or motor programmes, of your body. Because motor programmes are NOT continuously monitored, you should...

assume that the correct actions have been carried out without subsequently checking on the results.
take the appropriate action without considering the available options.
avoid relying on checklists and standard operating procedures.

By negative criticism of unsuccessful trials.

variant.question: How can the process of learning be enhanced?

options.text: By reinforcing successful performance.
By increasing the psychological pressure on the student.
By punishing the learner for unsuccessful trials.
By reinforcing errors.

easy to interpret the data in different ways.
difficult to stick to his/her interpretation of the data.

Rule-based behaviour.

Insight
Operant conditioning
Cognitive learning

destabilize cognitive progress and maintain the error.
are prompted by inductive factors.
have virtually no interaction with behaviour.

variant.question: During training, a student pilot experiences some significant difficulties, including failing an examination and an important flight test. With the help of a supportive instructor, the pilot is able to successfully complete the pilot training. What effect are these events likely to have on the pilot's subsequent behaviour?

options.text: If the pilot has a stable personality and a positive attitude, he/she is likely to adopt the same adult approach as the instructor to overcome difficulties, and accept that others can sometimes make errors but still be competent pilots.

The pilot completed the course, so the difficulties that occurred during the training course and the support of the instructor are likely to be quickly forgotten, and have NO effect on the subsequent behaviour of the pilot on the flight deck.

Regardless of the pilot's personality or attitude, the difficulties experienced in the training environment are likely to be dominant, and result in the pilot having low self-esteem, low confidence and to be compliant in his/her response to others.

If the pilot has a stable personality, the failures during training would lead to low self-esteem, and are likely to result in the pilot adopting behaviour which displays complacency, over-confidence, and intolerance of the mistakes made by others.

options.text: once running does not require conscious thought.
requires conscious thought to be initiated and maintained.
does not require conscious thought to be initiated but does require conscious thought to maintain.
does not require any conscious thought.

options.text: Actions return to an automatic mode.

A switch is made to knowledge-based mode in order to continue monitoring of the problem.

options.text: Mental schemes can result in rigid ways of thinking.

variant.question: What is a disadvantage of using mental schema when performing a familiar, but rather complex task?

variant.question: What is one advantage of mental schema when completing a familiar but complex task?

They ensure that attention becomes focussed onto narrowly defined areas.
Perceptions can be amplified into future expectations.
